intro: Strombocactus disciformis var. esperanzae, commonly known as Esperanza's disc-shaped cactus, is a rare and striking member of the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Mexico, where it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its short, globose stems that are covered in white, woolly spines, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, emerging from the areoles in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
